remarks.para: A WxePageStep is used to incorporatre user interaction into a or in the form of an ASPX Page that implents the interface.

Unlike steps without user interaction, the WxePageStep must transfer control to the ASP.NET infrastructure to display the page. Once the page has been rendered, the execution of the thread stops unitl it is resumed with a new post back request from the client. During the post back, the execution engine offers the following means of directing the control flow.

item.term: The event is handled by the page and results in the reposting of the page.
item.description: The execution engine does not change the behavior of the ASP.NET control flow.

item.term: The event handler invokes the method.
item.description: The page's PreRender and Render phases will not execute and the execution is transfered back to the executing WxePageStep, which will then end.

item.term: The event handler throws an exception.
item.description: The execution path will immedeatly leave the page and the exception will be passed through the hierarchy of steps until it is caught by a block or by a where the exception type has been registered for catching. Please refer to the 's documentation for details on working with exceptions.

item.term: The event handler invokes a sub-function.
item.description: The WxePageStep will back-up the page's post back data and transfer execution to the sub-function. After the execution has completed, the original post back data will be restored and the page's execution will restart with the post back cycle that originally caused the sub-function to be invoked. Use the flag to determine whether the current post back cycle has been caused by a repost.
